text: The allen institute is so cool. I got a flip-book from them a few years ago that shows the development of the human brain, from embryo to young child
Wonder what you guys think about this:

attachments.title: The 7 biggest problems facing science, according to 270 scientists
attachments.text: These are dark times for science so we asked hundreds of researchers how to fix it.
attachments.fallback: Vox: The 7 biggest problems facing science, according to 270 scientists

text: <@U061A5N1G>:  Nothing that surprising in there but still a good read. Discussion has been ongoing in a geology-coding slack team on replication (point 3 of the article). <http://Mybinder.org|Mybinder.org> and <http://rescience.github.io> have been mentioned, also trying to influence journal editors / reviewers to strength/enforce journal code documentation standards.
<@U1QPREQUC>: cool! I have seen mybinder before, have you you used it, or do you know anyone who has?
<@U061A5N1G>: I know other people who have used it. I was hoping to try mybinder this weekend. I'll post if I get something up.
For writing papers, has anyone looked at Authorea or ShareLaTeX?
if i was a professor, i would make my students to annotate and replicate some studies as homeworks.
`ReScience` will be a good class project

<@U061A5N1G>: I got something up on <http://mybinder.org|mybinder.org>. It was pretty simple. There is a binder badge/link to add to your github repo, but here is the direct link. <http://app.mybinder.org/user/6e31b6a91c38c74a18ca7037bd889776/notebooks/index.ipynb>
Hey <@U1QPREQUC>, I’m getting a “not found” message.
oh, nice! i like the use of seaborn
